description: iostat - Report Central Processing Unit (CPU) statistics and input/out‐

global_flags.description: into  sub-reports  so that all the metrics get displayed on a single line.
the  number  of  decimal places to use (0 to 2, default value is 2).
(e.g.  1.0k,  1.2M,  etc.) The units displayed with this option supersede any other default units (e.g.  kilobytes, sectors...) associated with the metrics.
by  a  human. The  device  name  will be printed on the right side. The report may also be broken into sub-reports if there are many metrics to display (use --compact option to prevent this).
This option must be used with option -g and indicates that  only global  statistics  for  the  group are to be displayed, and not statistics for individual devices in the group.
Display the registered device mapper names for any device mapper devices.  Useful for viewing LVM2 statistics.
Print version number then exit.
Display the CPU utilization report.
Display the device utilization report.
tells  it  to  use both  the standard kernel files and the files located in the al‐ ternative directory to read device statistics.

The  iostat  command reports statistics for each individual device in the list then a line  of global statistics for the group displayed as group_name and made up of all the devices in  the  list.  The  ALL  keyword means  that all the block devices defined by the system shall be included in the group.
This option is equivalent to specifying --human --pretty.

persistent device names. Keywords ID, LABEL, etc. spec‐ ify the type of the persistent name. These keywords are not lim‐ ited, only prerequisite is that directory with required  persis‐ tent  names  is  present in /dev/disk.  Optionally, multiple de‐ vices can be specified in the chosen persistent name type.   Be‐ cause  persistent device names are usually long, option --pretty is implicitly set with this option.
Display statistics in kilobytes per second.
Display statistics in megabytes per second.
JSON output field order is undefined, and new  fields  may be added in the future.

statistics  for  block devices and all their partitions that are used by the system.  If a device name is entered on the command line, then statistics for it and all its partitions  are displayed.  Last, the ALL keyword indicates that statistics have to be displayed for all the block devices and partitions defined by the system, including those that have never been used. If op‐ tion -j is defined before this option, devices  entered  on  the command  line  can  be specified with the chosen persistent name type.
Display a short (narrow) version of the report that  should  fit in 80 characters wide screens.
Print  the  time for each report displayed. The timestamp format may depend on the value of the S_TIME_FORMAT  environment  vari‐ able (see below).
Display extended statistics.
Omit first report with statistics since system boot, if display‐ ing multiple records at given interval.
Tell  iostat  to omit output for any devices for which there was no activity during the sample period.
